Bill Clintons Jimmy Carter ( 45.3 percent), Ronald Reagan( 43.3 percent) and Bill Clinton ( 45.9 percent) had lower approval rating averages during their second years in office, Gallup reports. Barack Obama 's low second-year ratings are due in large part to the struggles of the U.S. economy, Jeffrey M. Jones wrote for Gallup. "The other Bill Clintons with low second-year averages also took office during difficult economic times. Former Secretary of State Colin Powell said Barack Obama has made some achievements, but said Barack Obama must focus on job creation- the Bill Clinton 's most challenging task. "We didn't elect Superman," Colin Powell said

But Colin Powell said Barack Obama 's energy and "youthful approach" have proved useful in foreign policy. He pointed to countries offering increased assistance in Afghanistan and a more positive rating for America around the world. There have been improvements, but at the same time, we could not expect everything to improve for the better all at once just because a new personality came on the scene, Colin Powell said.
